content: I suggest you switch to table view, as that offers a one-line heading on message list pane with words such as SUBJECT CORRESPONDENTS DATE. CLick the DATE button to change order of sort. Then switch back to Card view
creator: davidsk

content: I did as you wrote, in this case all messages are sorted, except for grouped nested replies to messages. I need to sort responses to the same message by date, not all messages by date. The newest answers should be at the top and the oldest answers at the bottom.
creator: swiftkz

content:
Артём said
I did as you wrote, in this case all messages are sorted, except for grouped nested replies to messages. I need to sort responses to the same message by date, not all messages by date. The newest answers should be at the top and the oldest answers at the bottom.

Ah I see, You are talking about 'threads', such as a continuing conversation of replies.

When you use: Sort by Date, Descending, Unthreaded All emails are separate, in date order with newest at top.

When you use: Sort by Date, Descending, Threaded All top level emails are sorted by date with newest at top Any top level emails which have threads will display the threads appended in order received. So the top level folder which was sorted by Date and Descending will contain 'replies' in Date order with newest at bottom. This is the same as an ongoing conversation, eg: if you have ever used 'Chat' in a Help forum or Facebook Message then reponses are appended as if in an ongoing conversation. Thunderbird does the same.

This has been raised before by various people as an enhancement request, but so far, nothing has changed.

Some people say, it's difficult to locate new mail.

All top level emails in a collapsed state with unread mail in thread will be underlined.

Quick way to see all new/unread mail would be to use the Quick Filter toobar click on the envelope icon with tooltip 'Show only unread messages' Afterwards uncheck that icon to disable the filter and return to normal view. This is quick and easy and saves a lot of messing around looking for emails.

Alternative : Right click on top level email and select : Open > Open Message in Conversation This opens all emails in a new tab.

Benefits - Less cluttered view of all relevant emails as it is only specific to one topic - one group/thread. It will also include any responses you made that relate to that thread. You can sort all emails by Date Descending - newest at top Easy to close everything in one go - close the tab.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: Az után, hogy valami miatt a levélküldés megakadt a fiókban, újra próbáltam telepíteni a Thunderbird-öt úgy, hogya tűzfalat kikapcsoltam, illetve a Cookie-kat töröltem, mert azt olvastam, hogy ezek problémát okozhatnak. Ezek után azt elértem, hogy a fiókok vissza töltődtek, de az üzenetek nem. (lsd. 1. melléklet). És ebben az állapotban üzenetet sem tudtam küldeni, mert hibát jelzett, hogy a kiszolgáló nem tudott csatlakozni az SMTP serverhez. (lsd. Szintén az 1. sz. mell.) Az IMAP beállításait az interneten keresztül ellenőriztem, és összehasonlítottam a saját beállításommal, és azok szerintem megfelelőek voltak. (lsd. 2. sz. mell.) Ennek ellenére sem működik a levelezésem. A fiók felvitelekor a rendszer azt üzeni, hogy a Konfiguráció megtalálható a Mozilla ISP adatbázisában, de amikor megnyomom a KÉSZ gombot, akkor meg azt üzeni, hogy nem sikerült bejelentkezni a kiszolgálóra, Valószínűleg rossz a konfiguráció, a felhasználó név, vagy jelszó. Ezek után már nem tudom, hogy valójában mi lehet a hiba, és mit kellene csinálnom, hogy működjön végre a levelezésem. Ebben kérnék tanácsot, segítséget.
creator: lajos.willingsdorfer

content: Tisztelt fórumozók. A Thunderbird újratelepítése továbbra sem sikerült, mint azt az előző leírásomban jeleztem is. Az ott megadott adatokkal egy másik laptopon, és egy asztali gépen is sikeres volt a telepítés, de az én személyes laptomon ez nem sikerült. Ezek alapján azt feltételezem, hogy nem az általam, a fiók aktiválásához szükséges megadott adatokkal lehet a baj, hanem az én laptomon történt időközben valami olyan beállítás módosítás - esetleg valami frissítésnél,- ami azt okozza, hogy egy idő után nem töltötte le a leveleket, és ez az állapot fent maradt, ezért döntöttem az újra telepítés miatt, de az a korábban megírt módon sikerült, és nem működik. Ennek fényében van-e valakinek ötlete, hogy mit kellene megnéznem a laptomon, és állítani, hogy a thunderbird levelezés végre normálisan letölthető, és működő képes legyen, és ne vesszenek el a korábbi levelezéseim se.
creator: lajos.willingsdorfer

content:
For access on the PC, I suggest you have a secure password for PC, and if shared with other to have separate profiles for each user, plus a primary password on Thunderbird, and two-step authentication online. That provides some degree of safety, but does NOT

  1. provide reports on attempted activity to account (although a keystroke utility on PC may offer some information)
  2. protect you from someone hacking the windows password (there is freeware that does that easily)
  3. protect your account from someone browsing existing messages on the disk

content:
Thunderbird non è un prodotto commerciale, non esiste un assistenza tecnica tradizionale. Essendo il programma gratuito e le donazioni scarse non ci sono le risorse per mettere su una assistenza tecnica. Questo è solo un forum per gli utenti. Detto questo dovresti fornire più dettagli in modo che si possa provare ad aiutarti:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)

creator: davidsk

content:
The recommended (secure) settings are:

incoming POP server: pop.clara.net, 995, SSL/TLS, normal password, email address

incoming IMAP server: imap.clara.net, 993, SSL/TLS, normal password, email address

outgoing SMTP server: relay.clara.net, 465, SSL/TLS, normal password, email address

https://www.claranetsoho.co.uk/support/email/setup/setting-your-mailbox-through-pop-and-imap

There are some limits to POP or IMAP access:

https://www.claranetsoho.co.uk/support/email/troubleshooting/can-i-use-imap-and-pop-my-email-account

If you satisfy the requirements and still can't connect, disable a VPN if in use and possibly disable antivirus scanning of email.

Scooter said
Mapenzi, Erik is referring to the options in the "Window" menu. When a message is open in a window, Erik expects it to show the subject of the message as a menu option, but "Mozilla Thunderbird" appears instead.

When someone writes "window" I immediately think of the main Thunderbird window. Since I never read my messages in new windows I didn't make the association "window is a message window" Obviously he opens several message windows at the same time and wants to switch between them via the Window menu. content:
Please check your Firewall

Exit Thunderbird Access Firewall which might be controlled by computer default or by an Anti-Virus product you installed.

Thunderbird program must be set up as an allowed program to ensure no ports are being blocked. Please confirm Thunderbird is set up as an alowed program in Firewall.

content:
re :I note that Outlook.com uses a different port (993) from pop.clara.net (995) but I don't think that is significant?

That just means outlook is using imap connection and clara is using pop. They use different ports.

I notice you have 'email and accounts' selected for Public and Private, but I believe this relates to Microsoft accounts, so may include the outlook account because it's an alias in a Microsoft account.

But image does not specifically show it allows Thunderbird program access nor the Thunderbird updater.exe which includes non microsoft accounts.

I notice it has 'Allow another app' button greyed out. If you click on 'Change Settings' then I think it should enable that button. Does it enable the button if yes, click on it then add Thunderbird program.

Please confirm Thunderbird program thunderbird.exe is now allowed: C:\Program Files\Mozilla Thunderbird
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
OK I've added TB.exe to Defender - thanks for that tip.

However, TB will still not connect to my host server, and is not asking for my password.

I'm wondering, given that the same profile on my laptop works fine, could my desktop TB itself be broken in some way?

One surprise to me was finding two installations of TB in Programs and Features. Is that normal/not a problem? TB Help>About reports that I am presently on v128.3.3esr (32-bit), whereas Releases says the latest version is 137.01 (not esr).

Anything significant there?
creator: pmcabinet

content:
re : OK I've added TB.exe to Defender

Defender Firewall image not quite what I expected - I expected to see it list the location - same as Firefox. eg: Firefox (C:/Program Files/Mozilla Firefox) In the Defender Firewall image I expected to see a bit more than just 'Thunderbird'. eg: Thunderbird (C:/Program Files (86)/Mozilla Thunderbird )

It looks like you have Windows 64 bit computer. You have download and install Firefox for 64bit because the Defender Firewall says Firefox (C:/Program Files/Mozilla Firefox)

re :TB Help>About reports that I am presently on v128.3.3esr (32-bit) I thought you would be using 64bit and a bit more up to date as current version is 128.9.1esr

re : I am presently on v128.3.3esr (32-bit), whereas Releases says the latest version is 137.01 (not esr). Do not be worried about this. It just depends whether you want to be on 'ESR' or 'Release'. Personally, I would stay with ESR 128* at the moment. But it's your choice. It seems odd you are using 32bit and not 64 bit.

What is the difference between the two types of release: 'ESR' (new features are annual but bug and security fixes are monthly) The official annual extended support release. This release is intended for users who want all available new features on an annual basis and stability/security fixes on a monthly basis.

'Release' (more updates - both any new features and security/bug fixes are monthy) The official monthly release. This release is intended for users who want all available new features and bug fixes on a monthly basis.

Usually a new installation does not solve anything, but in your case it may be worth a try. Let's get a clean installation. Exit Thunderbird if running.

In Control Panel - 'Uninstall or change Program' Uninstall the v128.3.3esr version and if after doing that the other 115* version still displays then uninstall it. Do not delete or do anything with Profile folders and files.

Then go to the following link:

  • https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/all/
  • Select the language you prefer - 'English (British)'
  • For 'Release Channel' select: 'Thunderbird Extended Support Release'
  • Click on the 'need a specific installer' > chevron to see options and select the '64bit (.exe)'
  • Click on 'Download'

The 64 bit should install in C:\Program Files\Mozilla Thunderbird After installing please check Firewall again and make sure it selects the 'thunderbird.exe' in that location, so you can set as allowed.

creator: a.falciatori

content:
Se apri il priflo di Thunderbird troverai una cartella chiamata mail oppure chiamata imapmail

all'interno di queste cartelle troverai vari file, in particolare quelli con contengono la posta sono file senza estensione il cui nome rispecchia la struttura di cartelle e sotto-cartelle usate in Thunderbird:

  • i file mbox per le cartelle predefinite di Thunderbird avranno quindi il nome della cartella ma in inglese: inbox (in arrivo), sent (inviate), trash (cestino), junk (spam), etc.
  • i file mbox per le cartelle personalizzate dall'utente avranno invece il nome della cartella stessa
  • i file mbox creati con la funzione Archivia di Thunderbird avranno come nome un richiamo al criterio di archiviazione (per esempio l'anno)

è la dimensione di questi singoli file che se eccessiva può rallentare notevolmente Thunderbird.
creator: @next

content: Per quanto mi riguarda la dimensioni dei singoli files è mediamente di 2/3 gb il più grande supera gli 8 gb... però sono su un disco nvme abbastanza performante...

content:
Purtroppo non posso saperlo nemmeno io... Comunque: Se hai un backup a disposizione la soluzione migliore è quella di ripristinare le vecchie email. In caso ti spiego come procedere.

Se non hai un backup:

  • fanne uno adesso (non servirà a molto ma è sempre meglio farlo) -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo

poi segui queste operazioni di manutenzione:

  1. Compattare le cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle
  2. Riavviare Thunderbird
  3. Se il problema non è risolto, ricostruire l'indice globale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/ricostruzione-indice-globale
  4. Riavviare Thunderbird
  5. Se il problema non si è ancora risolto: click destro sulla cartella che contiene la mail illeggibile -> Proprietà -> [Ripara la cartella]

Nel tuo caso una ulteriore alternativa è quella di recuperare le mail mancati da un altro dei PC del tuo ufficio (se la posta è uguale per tutti)

content:
The account is only removed when user requests it. I suggest you click do this (assuming Windows): - on desktop, enter %appdata% in search bar and press enter. - that should open to the appdata\roaming directory - if there is a folder named thunderbird, click it to see if there is a profiles folder, and in that a profile. - next, if your account was IMAP, look in the imapmail folder to see if account is listed - if POP, look in the Mail folder

If the account is there, you can install thunderbird and reclaim the account without reentering it.

creator: davidsk

content:
It may be that thunderbird installed a fresh profile. Reinstall Thunderbird, if you haven't already. Then try this:

  1. click help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll down to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder', then back up one folder in windows file explorer and see what other profiles are in the profiles folder. If there is a second one, open it and see if there is a file named abook.sqlite (the addressbook) that looks to have a recent date. also check the imapmail folder for a possible IMAP account or the Mail folder for a possible POP account. If you find anything, you have found your missing profile
  2. click help>troubleshootinginformation, scrolll down to 'profiles' and click 'about:profiles', and see you can 'launch' the found profile. If not, click the 'create profile' button, then click next, then enter a short name for profile (such as PROFILE), then click the choose button to select the profile you just confirmed and click finish and launch

If that doesn't work, but the appdata\thunderbird folders is there, I would browse the profiles to see if you can locate any of the items I mentioned, including abook.sqlite, and possible account data in either imapmail or mail folders. When thunderbird isn't running, those files can be copied to the active proflle (abook.sqlite to the root folder and the message folders to Mail\Local Folders folder.

If that doesn't work, you can always post screenshots of the profiles you locate.
creator: davidsk

content:
"If you do a search in the c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird\profiles folder, you may find abook.sqlite and history.sqlite. These are the technical filenames of the addresssbook and the collected addressbook. You can import them with tools>import>importfromafile. This sometimes happens, that thunderbird creates a new profile and some content is left behind. No, this does not happen to everyone and is likely a glitch wherein an update was interrupted by another program, such as an antivirus product."

This might help. search for "abook.sqlite". Found it in a file, C:/windows.old. look for last oldest.

content:
How often do you have Thunderbird set to retrieve messages?

Are any quick filters active?

Do you use any message filters on incoming messages?

Does this problem occur if you use Thunderbird in troubleshooting mode ("Help" menu, "Troubleshoot Mode...)?
creator: mozilla98

content:
Set to retrieve messages = 10 minutes.

No quick filters applied.

I have message filetrs set to place messages from the inbox to their respective folder.

This probelm does not occur in troubleshooting mode.
creator: drossm1

content:
You wrote: "Thunderbird not displaying all new emails in the inbox. New emals are downloaded and visible in all other folders."

Then: "I have message filetrs set to place messages from the inbox to their respective folder."

Then: "2 new emails were downloaded to the inbox but are not visible."

Were those two messages filtered to a different folder?

Apparently, there are some messages that are not supposed to get filtered, but they don't appear in your inbox until after you re-start Thunderbird.

The fact that the problem does not occur in troubleshooting mode can indicate the source of the problem. See here: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/troubleshoot-mode-thunderbird

Do you use add-ons? Start Thunderbird normally, turn off add-ons, re-start Thunderbird, and see if the problem recurs.

If it does, then try, one at a time, using the default theme and turning off hardware acceleration.

creator: drossm1

content:
how do you know there are two messages waiting to download?

You disabled the add-ons, but that does not automatically disable the injected code from your antivirus that is blocked in safe mode. So disabling add-ons and troubleshooting mode are not the same thing.

Does mail download correctly when in troubleshooting mode?

I had issues with the important folder in gmail preventing inbox mail arriving when it was downloaded as POP, Not how most folk do it these days, but if you are using POP you need to disable those inbox sweeping folders like important in Gmail settings.

What folder settings to you have in the folder pane? I have heard of update issues with unified folders, so are you set to use ALL folders or one of the other options as shown below

content: No, the addressbook was not deleted. You possibly had a new profile created. If you browse the appdata\thunderbird\profiles folder, you will likely see your earlier profile that has the addressbook. Thunderbird may have created a new profile to protect your old profile. This also happens if you updated from an older version, in that the addressbook was converted to a newer format. You would need to provide specifics for us to help you. And, thank you for your prior donations. We value all users. If this was a recent situation, posting a screenshot of your appdata\roaming\thunderbird\profiles folder may let us assist. thank you.

content:
What OS are you using ? What version of Thunderbird are using ?

Where did you get the Thunderbird program download ? Did you get it from the official website : https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/all/

re :Every time Thunderbird is launched, a new tab opens with a donation offer.

If Thunderbird is launched, and it auto opens on 'Inbox' folder, then there is a donation view which gets displayed in the 'Message Pane' area until you select and email. The stuff that's displayed in the 'Message PAne' can be switched off: Settings > General uncheck the checkbox :' 'Wne Thunderbird launches, show the Start Page in the Message Area.'

But the only 'Donation' requests I ever see in a new tab always relates to an addon extension I have installed.

Firefox browser may have one opening in a new tab, but this seems odd for Thunderbird.

OR have we misunderstood something and what you mean is this: When you launch Thunderbird, your browser auto launches the 'donation' in a new tab. So you are seeing the donation in eg: Firefox.

An image of the issue would help so we can see whether the donation is in a Thunderbird tab or appearing in Browser tab.

Are you running both Windows OS and Linux OS on same computer and both access Thunderbird profile ?
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
My bad, I didn't catch initially that it was a new tab every time.

If it is offering the 2025 appeal, which AIUI you can only get with 137.0.x or 128.9.x, and it happens on every startup, then there are two possible causes (or a combination of the two):

  • you have lost write access to prefs.js file, which records whether you have been already presented with the appeal
  • the URL being used for the appeal is for some reason incorrect on your system.

Can you check that your prefs.js file is not read-only? https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profiles-where-thunderbird-stores-user-data

creator: @next

content:
You are correct - pressing 'J' on keyboard marks that email as spam/junk.

However, if email does not auto go to Spam/Junk fodler then you need to set up the Junk Controls for the account because it means Thunderbird has not been told what to do.

In Account Settings, Select 'Junk Settings' for the mail account

Destination and Retention: Select 'Move new junk messages to'

IF POP account: Select 'Junk folder on' and choose mail account name

IF IMAP account: Select 'Other' and choose the server folder name eg: 'Spam on account name'

Info on Junk Settings:

  • https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-and-junk-spam-messages
creator: Toad-Hall
